question.body: Which of the following are ways that the lymphatic system contributes to homeostasis of all body systems?

multiple_choice.choice: Drains excess interstitial fluid from tissues
Protects body systems from attack by harmful foreign substances
Drains excess interstitial fluid from tissues and protect body systems from attack by harmful foreign substances
Drains excess interstitial fluid from tissues, drains leaked plasma proteins from tissues, and protects body systems from attack by harmful foreign substances

response.feedback: Partially correct. This is true, but another answer is more complete and, therefore, more correct.
Partially correct. This is true, but another answer is more complete and, therefore, more correct.
Partially correct. This is true, but another answer is more complete and, therefore, more correct.
Correct. The lymphatic system not only contributes to the immune response but also contributes to homestasis by helping to control fluid levels.
